synopsis: In episode #9, Devam and Ahir welcome guest Vivek Menon, a passionate filmmaker and solutions consultant, who shares his journey of creating the web series 'New Normal' with his father. The conversation dives into the challenges of filmmaking, the importance of storytelling, and the value of embracing one's identity as an artist, all while maintaining a lighthearted and humorous tone.
quotes: You can't really open up and talk about my feelings unless I'm on a podcast.
If you can make a podcast that people will sit and listen to for over an hour, that's huge.
I think the best film school is just doing, making stuff.
Your experience and your voice is the most unique thing you can write.
It's hard to make a podcast that people will sit and listen to for over an hour.
The start of a project can feel like a ridiculous idea, but you just have to figure it out.
You should call yourself a filmmaker; if you're making things, you are one.
The best motivation for writing a script is going through something like a breakup.
If you spend so much time making something, you can't even watch it with people that are supporting you, that's ridiculous.
Passion isn't something you have; it's something that develops through practice.
